newsitem.title: NORWAY: NORDIC SKIING-HARADA TRIUMPHS ON HIGH HILL JUMPING.
newsitem.headline: NORDIC SKIING-HARADA TRIUMPHS ON HIGH HILL JUMPING.

text.p: An impressive second effort at 128 metres spurred Masahiko Harada of Japan to the high hill ski jumping gold medal at the Nordic skiing world championships on Saturday.
Harada, who led after the first round thanks to a jump of 124 metres, set the day's best mark with his second jump to score a winning total of 252.1 points.
German Dieter Thoma, fourth after a first jump at 121.5, hoped for gold after a second jump at 124 metres.
But Harada did not crack under pressure and Thoma had to be content with second place on 244.5 points.
Sylvain Freiholz of Switzerland was ninth after the first round but a second jump at 123.5 metres lifted him to third place on 237.3 points.
